snippet: The Federal Constitutional Court ruled that it is illegal for the federal government to pay parents who chose to care for their toddlers at home.
abstract: Germany’s highest court strikes down 2013 law, ruling it is illegal for federal government to pay parents, who do not use publicly subsidized day care, but instead take care of their toddlers at home; benefit was created to spur parents to stay home and raise their children once maternity leave aid expired.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Constitutional Court ruled that it is illegal for the federal government to pay parents who chose to care for their toddlers at home.

headline.main: Germany’s Top Court Strikes Down Federal Aid for Home Child Care
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Germany: Court Strikes Down Extended Maternity Pay
